fields.description:
h3. Summary
The URL http://confluence.mycompany.com/explain.action?queryString=logo is not returning any results.

See
* [How do I understand the ranking of Confluence's Search Results|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confkb/how-do-i-understand-the-ranking-of-confluence-s-search-results-785614686.html]

h3. Environment
* Confluence Data Centre 6.6.6

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Using Confluence Data Centre 6.6.6 go to 
#* http://confluence.mycompany.com/explain.action?queryString=logo

h3. Expected Results
We should see
 !explainActionCorrect.png! 

h3. Actual Results
We actually see
 !explainActionFail.png! 
 
h3. Notes
This can be reproduced in Confluence 6.6.6, the Enterprise Release but not Confluence 6.10 Data Centre, nor Standalone.

h3.Workaround
None
fields.summary: explain.action does not return results in Confluence Data Center

fields.description:
When we try to import a space which have shadowed users in entities.xml, this might result to an error.

Suppose we have two users with the same username (one of them is shadowed).
{code:xml}
<object class="ConfluenceUserImpl" package="com.atlassian.confluence.user">
    <id name="key"><![CDATA[8a7f80836102bd4d016104a5e1de0072]]></id>
    <property name="name"><![CDATA[xxx4109]]></property>
    <property name="lowerName"><![CDATA[xxx4109]]></property>
</object>

<object class="ConfluenceUserImpl" package="com.atlassian.confluence.user">
    <id name="key"><![CDATA[8a7f80835f99e63b015f9c11a34e006a]]></id>
    <property name="name"><![CDATA[xxx4109]]></property>
    <property name="lowerName"/>
</object>
{code}

In reality, the system won't import both of them. It will treat those users as the same because they have the same username. The piece of code responsible for it:

{code:xml}
// Try to reuse existing user mapping objects when performing an incremental import
if (!context.isPreserveIds() && classToPersist.equals(ConfluenceUserImpl.class)) {
    // Try to match using UUID
    if (confluenceUserDao.findByKey((UserKey) id) != null) {
        context.addExplicitIdMapping(unfixedHandle, id);
        return Collections.singletonList(unfixedHandle);
    }

    // Try to match using username
    String username = ((ConfluenceUser) objectToPersist).getName();
    ConfluenceUser user = confluenceUserDao.findByUsername(username);
    if (user != null) {
        context.addExplicitIdMapping(unfixedHandle, user.getKey());
        return Collections.singletonList(unfixedHandle);
    }
}
{code}

This is a problem because if we had entries for both these users in the old system (for example in user relations)

{code:xml}
    <object class="User2ContentRelationEntity" package="com.atlassian.confluence.internal.relations.dao">
        <id name="id">219546609</id>
        <property name="targetContent" class="Page" package="com.atlassian.confluence.pages">
            <id name="id">27893032</id>
        </property>
        <property name="sourceContent" class="ConfluenceUserImpl" package="com.atlassian.confluence.user">
            <id name="key"><![CDATA[8a7f80836102bd4d016104a5e1de0072]]></id>
        </property>
        <property name="targetType" enum-class="RelatableEntityTypeEnum"
                  package="com.atlassian.confluence.internal.relations">
            PAGE
        </property>
        <property name="relationName"><![CDATA[touched]]></property>
        <property name="creationDate">2018-04-20 14:44:59.037</property>
        <property name="lastModificationDate">2018-04-20 14:45:56.056</property>
        <property name="creator" class="ConfluenceUserImpl" package="com.atlassian.confluence.user">
            <id name="key"><![CDATA[8a7f80836102bd4d016104a5e1de0072]]></id>
        </property>
        <property name="lastModifier" class="ConfluenceUserImpl" package="com.atlassian.confluence.user">
            <id name="key"><![CDATA[8a7f80836102bd4d016104a5e1de0072]]></id>
        </property>
    </object>

    <object class="User2ContentRelationEntity" package="com.atlassian.confluence.internal.relations.dao">
        <id name="id">91488312</id>
        <property name="targetContent" class="Page" package="com.atlassian.confluence.pages">
            <id name="id">27893032</id>
        </property>
        <property name="sourceContent" class="ConfluenceUserImpl" package="com.atlassian.confluence.user">
            <id name="key"><![CDATA[8a7f80835f99e63b015f9c11a34e006a]]></id>
        </property>
        <property name="targetType" enum-class="RelatableEntityTypeEnum"
                  package="com.atlassian.confluence.internal.relations">
            PAGE
        </property>
        <property name="relationName"><![CDATA[touched]]></property>
        <property name="creationDate">2018-01-17 17:09:26.374</property>
        <property name="lastModificationDate">2018-01-17 17:09:26.374</property>
        <property name="creator" class="ConfluenceUserImpl" package="com.atlassian.confluence.user">
            <id name="key"><![CDATA[8a7f80835f99e63b015f9c11a34e006a]]></id>
        </property>
        <property name="lastModifier" class="ConfluenceUserImpl" package="com.atlassian.confluence.user">
            <id name="key"><![CDATA[8a7f80835f99e63b015f9c11a34e006a]]></id>
        </property>
    </object>
{code}

The system will try to insert both of them, but with the same user_key in sourceEntity (because it treats users with equal username as the same users). This will lead to unique key violation in usercontent_relations table:

{code:none}
UNIQUE KEY `u2c_relation_unique` (`TARGETCONTENTID`,`SOURCEUSER`,`RELATIONNAME`),
{code}

The import should not treat users with the same username as the same users because they are not. We have a notion of shadowed usernames and currently it fails the import, which should be fixed.
fields.summary: Importing content relations from shadowed users fails

fields.description:
h2. Issue Summary
We have a document called [Troubleshooting Collaborative Editing|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/troubleshooting-collaborative-editing-858772087.html] that states the following about Collaborative Editing status page (<Base-URL-Here>/admin/confluence-collaborative-editor-plugin/configure.action):
{quote}
Note: if you're running Confluence Data Center, this page will only be able to tell you if the current Confluence node is connected to your Synchrony cluster. You may want to use a third party monitoring tool to help you monitor your Synchrony cluster.  
{quote}
However, the documentation does not explain why this screen doesn't work for Data Center users, so people reading it have to go figure. :)

h2. Request
Reason why it doesn't work for Data Center is a bug. Can we update the documents to reflect that and have a more precise information to people using it? Bug listed below:
* Collaborative Editing - Status Screen doesn't work for Data Center - [CONFSERVER-56052|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-56052]
fields.summary: Troubleshooting Collaborative Editing - Modify Documentation

fields.description:
h2. Issue Summary
Confluence has a screen where Collaborative Editing/Synchrony statuses can be checked. This screen doesn't work properly for Data Center implementations, only for Standalone implementations. URL is listed below:
* <Confluence_Base_URL>/admin/confluence-collaborative-editor-plugin/configure.action

h2. Environment Specifics
* Confluence Data Center
* Synchrony Running in its own cluster

h2. Current State
Assuming we have Confluence Data Center running with Synchrony on its own cluster, in order to terminate Synchrony we need to execute Stop scripts in Synchrony nodes or kill all Synchrony processes (not recommended).

Once we do that, Collaborative Editing/Synchrony status screen looks like below - Observe it still says {{On/Running}}:
!Screen Shot 2018-07-04 at 16.47.29.png|thumbnail!

h2. Expected Behaviour
Status screen should have changed to {{Off/Not Required}} as it does for Server implementations:
!Screen Shot 2018-07-04 at 16.49.10.png|thumbnail!

h2. Impact
There's no reliable way of monitoring Collaborative Editing/Synchrony through Confluence native screens if in a Data Center implementation.

h2. Workaround
If you want to check Synchrony status, hit its cluster URL through below endpoint and check the response:
* <Synchrony_Base_URL>/synchrony/heartbeat

In case response is different than 200, then Synchrony is not running properly.

Several additional checks can be found here: [How To Check The Status Of Synchrony For Confluence Data Center|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confkb/how-to-check-the-status-of-synchrony-for-confluence-data-center-953651062.html]
fields.summary: Collaborative Editing - Status Screen doesn't work for Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Summary
According to [Is it possible to turn off the table sorting feature|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confkb/is-it-possible-to-turn-off-the-table-sorting-feature-300816956.html] users can disable this system add-on if they don't want the table sorting feature in Confluence.

However, if you disable this add-on, it makes impossible to insert the [Content Report Table|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/content-report-table-macro-317194676.html] macro (and likely other things).

h3. Environment
* Confluence Server (tested in 6.6.0, 6.10.0, 6.9.1 as of the writing of this bug)

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Follow the steps in [Is it possible to turn off the table sorting feature|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confkb/is-it-possible-to-turn-off-the-table-sorting-feature-300816956.html]
# Create a new page.
# Insert the *Content Report Table* macro on a page, save.

h3. Expected Results
Upon viewing the page, you'd expect to see the macro.

!expected_results.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results
Macro does not display.

{noformat}Caused by: com.atlassian.soy.renderer.SoyException: Unable to compile Soy templates at: com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.confluence-content-report-plugin:resources{noformat}

{noformat}Caused by: com.google.common.util.concurrent.UncheckedExecutionException: java.lang.IllegalStateException: Required plugin module com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.confluence-sortable-tables:sortable-table-hooks was either missing or disabled{noformat}

 !actual_results.png|thumbnail!

h3.Workaround
Workaround would be to leave the add-on enabled.
fields.summary: Disabling Confluence Sortable Tables breaks Content Report Table macro

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When trying to subscribe to Team Calendars from Microsoft Outlook via CalDAV following this [documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/teamcal/subscribe-to-team-calendars-from-microsoft-outlook-251005307.html/], the user is unable to update the calendar by moving, deleting or changing an event type in Outlook, changes are not be reflected in the team calendars.

Also, when a user created an event and add a user in the subject, it will not be updated as a 'Who' in Team Calendar, instead it will be added in the subject of the event. 

The only thing that will be updated when changed is the subject.
h3. Environment

Confluence 6.7.1, T.C 6.0.12
Confluence 6.10.1, T.C 6.0.20

h3. Steps to Reproduce

*Moving an event*
 # Go to Event in Outlook.
 # Change the Start time and End Time.
 # Save and Close.
 # Click Synchronise Now.
 # Event will not be moved in Team Calendars.

*Delete an event*
 # Go to Event.
 # Click Delete.
 # Click Synchronise Now.
 # Event will not be deleted in Team Calendars.

*Change an Event Type*
 # Right-click on any calendar entry in the list and choose any 'Purple' to change its color.
 # Event in Team Calendar will not be updated and will change to blue colored 'Event'.

*Add a user in the subject*
 # From your Calendar folder, select New Appointment
 # Enter subject as *admin;AL* . Then enter the location, start time, and end time.
 # Select Save & Close to save your appointment
 # Click Synchronise Now.
 # The event in Team Calendar will appear with a subject "admin;AL". Instead of updating admin in the 'Who' column.

h3. Expected Results

Changes will be synced in Team Calendars.
h3. Actual Results

Changes are not synced in Team Calendars.
h3. Workaround

There is currently no workaround for this issue.
fields.summary: Not able to move, delete, insert a person and update event type in Outlook via CalDAV

fields.description:
When printing a page which holds a table, the table borders are hardly to see in the printout. Our current production version (6.5) and earlier versions were fine. I suspect that the version 6.7 has started with printing the table borders in a lighter grey and/or thinner line, when Atlassian gave confluence a "fresh look".  I'm reporting the issue on 6.9 as we jumped over some revisions.

 

(maybe this should be a bug, but I can't create one due to the Jira permission settings)

fields.description:
h2. Steps to Reproduce:
# Install Confluence 6.7.x and Confluence Question add-on version 2.6.6
# Create Space in Confluence
# [Add an Ask a Question button to a page|https://confluence.atlassian.com/questions/integrate-questions-with-your-spaces-407724495.html#Integratequestionswithyourspaces-AddanAskaQuestionbuttontoapage]
 !CreateFromTemplateMacro.png|thumbnail! 
# Try to create new Question using the Ask a Question button

h2. Expected Result
User will be shown/re-direct to the Question template when clicking on the button

h2. Actual Result
Create Dialog loading indefinitely as shown
 !CreateQuestionFromTemplate.png|thumbnail! 

In the Developer Tools' Console tab, following error message can be observe
 !ConsoleTab.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Additional notes on the symptom:
||Confluence version || Confluence Question version || Symptom||
| 6.4.3 | 2.4.19| Create dialog loading indefinitely|
| 6.7.0 | 2.6.6 | Create dialog loading indefinitely |
| 6.8.0 | 2.5.5 | Create dialog loading indefinitely, however it will re-redirect user to Question when cancelled and re-tried
| 6.9.0 | 2.6.6 |Create dialog loading indefinitely, however it will re-redirect user to Question when cancelled and re-tried|

Screenshot below shown the Question template that user will be re-directed to when re-tried to create Question from the Ask a Question Button.
 !Redirected.png|thumbnail! 


h3.Workaround
Use [Question List Macro|https://confluence.atlassian.com/questions/integrate-questions-with-your-spaces-407724495.html#Integratequestionswithyourspaces-Addalistofquestionstoapage] to enable user to create Question from Confluence page
fields.summary: Ask a Question Dialog loading indefinitely

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Warning messages when deleting a Group is not accurate.

When trying to delete a group, a warning message below is shown before confirming the group delete:
{quote}
*Note*: All the above permissions will be removed.

_<group_name>_ currently has members. The memberships will be deleted.
Deleting a group will remove all permission restrictions associated with it. Content that is only restricted to this group will become available to all confluence users. Are you sure you want to delete _<group_name>_?
{quote}
Based on the message above, pages that have View or Edit restriction only for this group would become _no restriction_ and can be viewed/edited by everyone.
However, after deleting the group. Pages that are formally restricted to only this group would still be restricted and other users that never had the permission to view/edit would still have the restriction applied.

h3. Environment
Confluence 6.7.2

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new Group and add in any group member
# Go to Space Permission and grant permission to this group for a specific space
# Create a page in the space above and apply View/Edit restriction to only the newly created group in Step 1
# Delete the group created in Step 1
# Login using other user and try to view the new page that is created in Step 3

h3. Expected Results
Any user who has appropriate Space Permission can view/edit the page

h3. Actual Results
Restrictions still apply in the page created in Step 3. Other users that are not specifically allowed to view/edit the page won't be able to perform said action.
fields.summary: Warning messages when deleting a Group is not accurate.

fields.description:
As an administrator, I would like to have the first day of the week on the date picker to be set as *Sunday when English (US) is the default instance language*.

According to ISO-8601 the first day of the week is Monday. However, for North America and also other countries outside of it, the first day of the week is *Sunday*
- [*Week Numbering*|https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Week#Week_numbering]

h3. Why is it important
Having a different first day on the calendar can lead to incorrectly scheduled appointments and meetings. This can cause major drawbacks for businesses where time is the biggest constraint.
fields.summary: Set First Day of The Week as Sunday for English (US)

fields.description: The [Macro usage statistics|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/macros-139387.html#Macros-Macrousagestatistics] lists how often each macro is used in all spaces of the Confluence site. This suggestion would be to implement a filter so the user can see the same list but filtered by one specific space.
fields.summary: Add filter by space in Macro Usage Statistics tool

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Using [Task Report Macro|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/task-report-macro-590260009.html?_ga=2.176581733.1122300989.1530604979-1293891407.1527167282], when a user enters multiple labels separated by a comma, it will treat them like an OR statement, and show all tasks that have either one of those labels. 

This is not clear from the documentation.

There's a feature request to be able to toggle: CONFSERVER-45518

h3. Suggested Solution
A customer in Community has suggested the following update to our documentation: 
{quote}The documentation currently only says: 

Filter by Label. The macro will only display tasks on pages with this label. You can enter multiple labels, separated by a comma.
I suggest changing it to:

Filter by Label. The macro will display tasks on all pages with any of the labels specified in this list, separated by a comma. Confluence Search Syntax is not supported.{quote}
fields.summary: Clarify Task Report Macro documentation regarding use of Labels

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When connecting JIRA Service Desk with Confluence, if a page contains the *[Table of Contents macro|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/table-of-contents-macro-724765294.html]*, the same will not be displayed while on the Service Desk view (https://example.atlassian.net/servicedesk/customer/kb/view/pageid).

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Link a JIRA Service Desk project to a Space
# Create a page on that space with a [Table of Contents|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/table-of-contents-macro-724765294.html] macro
# back to Service Desk, navigate to the page with the Table of Contents macro
# Notice that it will display only a blank part on the KB

h3. Expected Results
The macro is expected to be displayed on the body of the page

h3. Actual Results
No content is displayed.  

h3.Workaround
No workaround found at the moment.
fields.summary: Table of Contents Macro Does not Display in Service Desk

fields.description:
h3. Summary
System Error page in Show All Users page is seen,
After attempting to create duplicated users by clicking the "Add" button a couple of times, during new user creation.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to Confluence Admin > Users > AddUsers
# Fill up the required information
# Press the "Add" button twice rapidly
# The error message will appear 
{panel}
The following error(s) occurred:

Failed to create the user 'user1'. Check your server logs for more information.
{panel}
and the following error appears in the logs, showing that the user was successfully created on the first click, and the subsequent user creation was prevented:
{code}
2018-07-03 18:00:04,877 ERROR [http-nio-8090-exec-4] [confluence.user.actions.CreateUserAction] execute Failed to create user: user1
 -- referer: http://localhost:8090/admin/users/createuser.action | url: /admin/users/docreateuser.action | traceId: bd5aa4a33d93d50c | userName: admin | action: docreateuser
com.atlassian.core.exception.InfrastructureException: com.atlassian.user.impl.DuplicateEntityException: User with name [user1] already exists in this repository (Embedded Crowd)
...
Caused by: com.atlassian.user.impl.DuplicateEntityException: User with name [user1] already exists in this repository (Embedded Crowd)
{code}
# Attempt to list out users by going to {{<base_url>/admin/users/showallusers.action}}

h3. Expected Results
Since duplicated users are not created, list of users should be displayed as expected

h3. Actual Results
System Error page is returned:
{code}
Cause
java.lang.NullPointerException
    at com.google.common.base.Preconditions.checkNotNull(Preconditions.java:210)

Stack Trace:[hide]
java.lang.NullPointerException
	at com.google.common.base.Preconditions.checkNotNull(Preconditions.java:210)
	at com.google.common.collect.ImmutableCollection$ArrayBasedBuilder.add(ImmutableCollection.java:339)
	at com.google.common.collect.ImmutableList$Builder.add(ImmutableList.java:652)
	at com.google.common.collect.ImmutableList$Builder.add(ImmutableList.java:630)
	at com.google.common.collect.ImmutableCollection$Builder.addAll(ImmutableCollection.java:282)
	at com.google.common.collect.ImmutableCollection$ArrayBasedBuilder.addAll(ImmutableCollection.java:360)
	at com.google.common.collect.ImmutableList$Builder.addAll(ImmutableList.java:665)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.api.model.pagination.PageResponseImpl$Builder.addAll(PageResponseImpl.java:164)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.api.model.pagination.PageResponseImpl.from(PageResponseImpl.java:80)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.api.impl.pagination.PaginationServiceImpl.executeBatch(PaginationServiceImpl.java:173)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.api.impl.pagination.PaginationServiceImpl.lambda$doRequestInTransaction$2(PaginationServiceImpl.java:157)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.api.impl.ReadOnlyAndReadWriteTransactionConversionTemplate.lambda$executeInReadOnly$0(ReadOnlyAndReadWriteTransactionConversionTemplate.java:48)
	at org.springframework.transaction.support.TransactionTemplate.execute(TransactionTemplate.java:133)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.api.impl.ReadOnlyAndReadWriteTransactionConversionTemplate.executeInReadOnly(ReadOnlyAndReadWriteTransactionConversionTemplate.java:48)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.api.impl.pagination.PaginationServiceImpl.doRequestInTransaction(PaginationServiceImpl.java:139)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.api.impl.pagination.PaginationServiceImpl.doPaginationListRequest(PaginationServiceImpl.java:71)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.internal.user.UserSearchServiceInternalImpl.doUserSearch(UserSearchServiceInternalImpl.java:70)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.user.actions.AbstractSearchCrowdUsersAction.doUserSearch(AbstractSearchCrowdUsersAction.java:98)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.user.actions.BrowseUsersAction.execute(BrowseUsersAction.java:9)
{code}
 
h3.Workaround
Flush Cache by going to Confluence Admin > Cache Management > Flush All

h3. Notes
After Flushing Cache, the issue will not be able to replicated again.
The issue could be replicated again after the next restart
fields.summary: Clicking "Add User" button twice while creating a new user returns with error message

fields.description:
Problems with page restricted warning and request access from viewpageattachments
h4. Bug Description

When a restricted page is accessed from its {{viewpageattachments.action}} page, the "You don't have permission to view" message is not properly shown.
 Also, the "request access" button does not work from this page.

Accessing a restricted page from the {{viewpage.action}}
 * Message is properly shown on the UI (/)
 !image001.png|thumbnail!
 * Request access button works properly (/)
 !image002.png|thumbnail!

Accessing a restricted page from the {{viewpageattachments.action}}
 * Message is properly shown on the UI (x)
 ** We get a "confluence.request.access.pagerestricted.requestaccess.title..page" message instead
 !image003.png|thumbnail!
 * Request access button works properly (x)
 ** Request is sent to wrong REST API method: {{/rest/access/latest/page/restriction/7602187/request/}}
 !image004.png|thumbnail!

Accessing the {{createpage.action}} to a space on which the user doesn't have the _Add page_ permission leads to a similar problem.
 !create_page_img001.png|thumbnail! 

h4. Workaround

None so far.
 Use the request from the {{viewpage.action}}
fields.summary: Problems with page restricted warning and request access from viewpageattachments

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Similar to the issue described in CONFSERVER-40130, Synchrony Proxy is still using the old commons-collections library which allows for remote code execution. We can see this by looking at the following directories:
{code:java}
<Confluence-Install>/confluence/confluence/WEB-INF/lib/commons-collections-3.2.2.jar
<Confluence-Install>/confluence/synchrony-proxy/WEB-INF/lib/commons-collections-3.2.1.jar
{code}
h3. Notes

Similar to CONFSERVER-40130, we’ll need to update the library for Synchrony Proxy.
fields.summary: Upgrade to version 3.2.2 of apache commons-collections

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When upgrading to Team Calendar 6.0.14, an SQLException is recorded in the application log.
h3. Environment
 * Any version of Confluence
 * Team Calendar 5.3.19 upgraded to 6.0.14
 * MySQL 5.6

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Install Confluence with MySQL 5.6 and Team Calendar 5.3.19

fields.description:
h2. Environment
* Confluence 6.6.x
* Jira 7.6.x

h2. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Confluence page.
# Insert the Jira Issues macro.
# Insert a JQL filter and include *only specific custom fields* you require.
# Save the Confluence page.
# Reload the page.
# Review the Jira access log regarding the request called.

h2. Expected Behavior
Only specific custom fields as defined in the Jira issues macro will be searched.  {{field=allcustom}} parameter should be removed.

h2. Actual Behavior
All custom fields are being searched through and it causes the search to be extremely slow especially with instances comprised of large amount of custom fields. {{field=allcustom}} is apparent in the request URL e.g.
{code}
http://localhost:53922/jira763/sr/jira.issueviews:searchrequest-xml/temp/SearchRequest.xml?jqlQuery=&field=summary&field=type&field=created&field=updated&field=due&field=assignee&field=allcustom&field=reporter&tempMax=1000
{code}

h2. Workaround
Exclude custom field as column to display under the _Display options_. Please find the differences in the search request URLs below using the same JQL query. Note the {{field=allcustom}} parameter is removed when custom field column is not configured in the display options.
h5. With Custom FIeld
{code}
127.0.0.1 672x266x1 admin [28/Jun/2018:11:12:40 +0200] "GET /jira/sr/jira.issueviews:searchrequest-xml/temp/SearchRequest.xml?tempMax=20&returnMax=true&jqlQuery=project+%3D+Scrum++&field=summary&field=type&field=created&field=updated&field=due&field=assignee&field=reporter&field=priority&field=status&field=resolution&field=allcustom&field=wonderful+choice&field=link HTTP/1.1" 200 3106 1174 "-" "Apache-HttpClient/4.5.5 (Java/1.8.0_131)" "q23bh4"
{code}
h5. Without Custom Field
{code}
127.0.0.1 674x272x1 admin [28/Jun/2018:11:14:05 +0200] "GET /jira/sr/jira.issueviews:searchrequest-xml/temp/SearchRequest.xml?tempMax=20&returnMax=true&jqlQuery=project+%3D+Scrum+++&field=summary&field=type&field=created&field=updated&field=due&field=assignee&field=reporter&field=priority&field=status&field=resolution&field=link HTTP/1.1" 200 1735 71 "-" "Apache-HttpClient/4.5.5 (Java/1.8.0_131)" "lw2vqt"
{code}
fields.summary: Regression - JIRA Issues Macro fetching unnecessary fields from JIRA
Backport CONFSERVER-54554 to 6.6

fields.description:
h3. Summary

The index c_si_ct_pv_cs_cd_idx on CONTENT table is recreated with wrong definition when confluence is upgraded under MySQL.
This also affects MS SQL Server.

h3. Environment
* MySQL 5.6.32

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Install any older Confluence in a linux instance. e.g. Confluence 5.10.8  
# Upgrade the Confluence to latest version e.g. Confluence 6.10.0
# Then issue the following command
{code:sql}
show create table CONTENT;
{code}

h3. Expected Results
The definition of the c_si_ct_pv_cs_cd_idx shall be as below.
{code:xml}
  KEY `c_si_ct_pv_cs_cd_idx` (`SPACEID`,`CONTENTTYPE`,`PREVVER`,`CONTENT_STATUS`,`CREATIONDATE`),
{code}
Note: Expected as above because this is the definition on the clean install.

h3. Actual Results
The definition of the c_si_ct_pv_cs_cd_idx is as below.
{code:xml}
  KEY `c_si_ct_pv_cs_cd_idx` (`CREATIONDATE`,`PREVVER`,`SPACEID`,`CONTENTTYPE`,`CONTENT_STATUS`),
{code}

 
h3. Notes
This issue is critical because this can trigger CONFSERVER-52429 letting MySQL optimizer to wrongly choose this multi-column index, c_si_ct_pv_cs_cd_idx.
It is assumed that queries that has _order by CREATIONDATE_  is looked up by the index specifies _CREATIONDATE_ in a first column because of the description in https://dev.mysql.com/doc/refman/5.6/en/multiple-column-indexes.html


h3.Workaround
*For MySQL database*
Manually recreate the index. 
{code:sql}
-- Drop the index
ALTER TABLE CONTENT DROP INDEX c_si_ct_pv_cs_cd_idx ;

-- Create the index manually
CREATE INDEX
    `c_si_ct_pv_cs_cd_idx`
ON
    `<Database Name>`.`CONTENT`
    (
        `SPACEID`,
        `CONTENTTYPE`,
        `PREVVER`,
        `CONTENT_STATUS`,
        `CREATIONDATE`
    )
{code}
\\
\\
*For MS SQL SERVER*
* Delete the current index definition.
{code:sql}
GO
DROP INDEX c_si_ct_pv_cs_cd_idx   
    ON [dbo].[CONTENT];  
GO
{code}
* Create the index using the expected column order.
{code:sql}
GO
CREATE NONCLUSTERED INDEX [c_si_ct_pv_cs_cd_idx] ON [dbo].[CONTENT]
(
	[SPACEID] ASC,
	[CONTENTTYPE] ASC,
	[PREVVER] ASC,
	[CONTENT_STATUS] ASC,
	[CREATIONDATE] ASC
)WITH (PAD_INDEX = OFF, STATISTICS_NORECOMPUTE = OFF, SORT_IN_TEMPDB = OFF, DROP_EXISTING = OFF, ONLINE = OFF, ALLOW_ROW_LOCKS = ON, ALLOW_PAGE_LOCKS = ON) ON [PRIMARY]
GO
{code}
fields.summary: c_si_ct_pv_cs_cd_idx recreated with wrong definition when upgraded under MySQL and MS SQL SERVER

fields.description:
Steps to replicate:


1. Spin Confluence 6.6.5 and Jira 7.6.4 instances and establish an application link in between them.
2. Install Team Calendars 6.0.14 on Confluence.
3. Add a Calendar.
4. Get to Jira and create a project with a couple issues inside it.
5. On Confluence, add a new event to the Calendar, which is Jira Issues Dates type.
6. Use a JQL on the event that points to that project.
7. Don’t forget to define Start and End date on the issues and use them as dates inside the event.
8. Once done, try to drag and drop the event to change its end date. NPE is thrown. PFA

When NPE is fixed, integration still does not work. Event can be successfully moved, but no communication with Jira happens after that. According to documentation, changes to TC Jira events should be reflected in Jira. This also doesn't work for single issue date.

Most probable this is a regression after refactoring.
fields.summary: Changes to TeamCalendar 'Jira Issue Date' events are not propagated to Jira

fields.description:
h2. Description
In order to install Synchrony in a Data Center environment, administrators often follow [Configuring Synchrony for Data Center|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/configuring-synchrony-for-data-center-858772125.html] documentation.

This document can lead to mistakes, since it looks more like a collection of information regarding Synchrony than like a step-by-step guide on how to get it implemented. Although it is possible to get Synchrony installed in DC with this collection, it would be better to enhance the documentation to avoid mistakes and ensure customers are properly installing Synchrony.

h2. Suggested Changes
The document, ideally, should look like below - If needed, we can split below tasks in different documents and link them into the main one:
# Step-by-Step guide to deploy Synchrony to its own node(s).
## Which configuration should I do in the node receiving Synchrony?
## Do I need to have open ports in there? Which ones?
## Which configuration do I need to do in Synchrony start-up scripts?
## Should I change anything on Confluence side? URL information perhaps? Service URL?
## Should I change anything at my Load Balancer?
## If Confluence runs over HTTPS, should I have Synchrony URL working as HTTPS in a browser level and being terminated at the Load Balancer or not?
## How many nodes do I need? Is there a balance in the sense of spinning one Synchrony node for each two Confluence nodes, for example?
## How can I validate if my installation is correct? I mean, any testing steps to ensure that Confluence can connect to my nodes properly?
# Step-by-Step guide to deploy Synchrony in the same node as Confluence is running.
## What's the difference in between choosing this option and choosing to deploy Synchrony in its own nodes?
## Do I need to spin Synchrony process in one Confluence node only or in all of them? For example, if my DC has four nodes, shall I spin Synchrony in all of them or in a single node only? What's recommended for this scenario?
# Specific Documentation about Parameters
## What's the meaning of each parameter inside my script.
## Which parameters inside Confluence start-up script I should pay attention to in order to run Synchrony properly and what do they mean.
## Does Synchrony and Confluence URL need to share the same address but with different context paths? Or can I run Confluence as www.confluence.com and have Synchrony URL as www.synchrony.com as long as my Load Balancer knows how to find the right place to direct traffic to?
fields.summary: Update Synchrony for Data Center Documentation

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Confluence whitelist is case sensitive for domains.

h3. Suggested Solution

The Whitelist could parse the domains to lower-case automatically, replicating what browsers do when you type a domain with upper-case letters. Preferably, it would be case insensitive for domains to match the [RFC 4343|https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc4343] specification.

h3. Why this is important

If a domain with upper-case letters is added to the whitelist, requests with the same domain but in all lower-case letters will be blocked. Example:

# Create an application link to the domain *Company.com*
# An automatic entry for *Company.com* will be added to the whitelist
# Trying to add an RSS feed with *company.com* will fail as the source is not allowed
# Changing the feed to use *Company.com* will work as expected

This can cause confusion as users are familiarized to the browser's behavior of parsing the domain to lower-case.
 
h3. Workaround 

Add a separate entry to the whitelist with all lower-case letters.
fields.summary: Confluence Whitelist is case sensitive for domains

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-33761].
  {panel}

The view trash page currently only has:
Page name (non linked) and Restore | Purge links.

I feel that (sortable/filterable) fields could include:

Page name (linked with page URL), Deleted by (user), Deleted (date/time), Attachments (link to page attachments) as well as the Restore | Purge

Page history should include whether something has been restored from the trash as a page revision.
fields.summary: The Space Admin > View Trash page should have more fields for deleted items so an admin can more easily view what has been deleted by space users.

fields.description:
We constantly find web-links in Confluence pages that point to other Confluence pages.  This happens for two reasons:

# People misinterpret the advice to use TinyLinks for linking _into_ the Confluence instance from other web applications, as advice to use TinyLinks when linking _between_ wiki pages.
# Some pages with certain characters in their page titles, display a URL with pageId= , and users copy-paste these into wiki pages.

This not only makes for ugly links, but deprives readers of the page of a useful bit of information when viewing the page – namely, it does not display the target URL, with the targets space-key and page title, in the link URL.

Just as the Editor can auto-convert a pasted Confluence URL, it should not be difficult to do the same for TinyLinks and pageID links.  

This would vastly improve both the editing experience, and the viewing experience.

fields.description:
When deploying a *Jira Issues Macro* on a Confluence page, there is a field called *Maximum Issues*. 
This field has a tip telling to "Leave empty to get all issues". 
However, this is not true. Leaving the field empty defaults the value of said field to 1000.

The tip could be changed to "The value must be between 1 and 1000", since the macro may not load *all issues* if the customer has more than 1000.
fields.summary: Improve Jira Issues Macro Maximum Issues Tip

fields.description:
Using Confluence 6.9.1 on-premise server.

When, after changing the title of the page, I add a new link to the page using the search feature in Insert Link dialog, the link text shows the old page title.

Steps to reproduce:
 # Create new page
 # Update title to "Page A"
 # Save page
 # Create new page
 # Update title to "Page B"
 # Save page
 # Edit Page A
 # Rename title to "Page X"
 # Edit Page B
 # Open "Insert link" dialog
 # Search for "Page X"
 # Select "Page X" from drop-down link
 # Link text shows "Page X"
 # Click "Insert" to insert link
 # Link shows in edit mode as "Page X"
 # Save page
 # Link shows in view mode as "Page A" !!!!

 

I have tried: clearing all caches, re-indexing content, restarting service, re-editing the link, re-editing the page title. 

I cannot get the link to show the new page title - whatever I try. Happens with all pages tested.

Is this a bug or is there some way that I can get Confluence to update the link text?
fields.summary: Text of new internal Confluence links showing previous page title

fields.description:
You can't start Confluence using {{start-confluence.bat}} if Java is not installed, and JAVA_HOME or JRE_HOME system environment variable is set correctly. 

*Steps to reproduce:*

1. In Windows, check that Java is NOT installed, and that there's no env variable for either JAVA_HOME or JRE_HOME ({{echo %JAVA_HOME%}})
2. Install Confluence using the installer (don't install as a service)
3. Complete the setup wizard. 
4. Stop Confluence. 
5. Attempt to start confluence using {{start-confluence.bat}}

*Expected result:*

Confluence starts, using the bundled JRE.

*Actual result:*

Window closes immediatley, and Confluence does not start.

*Solution*

{panel}
Start Confluence using the options in Windows' Start menu, or run {{<install-directory>/startup-bundled-jre.bat}}. 

The {{start-confluence.bat}} command is only used when you've installed Confluence manually, and are not using the bundled JRE{panel}
fields.summary: Can't restart Confluence after installing using windows installer and bundled JRE

fields.description:
Is there a way to customize how “JIRA events" on a wiki calendar?

I’m pulling issues from JIRA and showing due dates on a wiki calendar. The wiki calendar shows “<issue key>– Release 1 (Due Date)”. “Release 1” is the issue summary. I’d like to have the ability to change what is shown on the calendar.

For example :
 * Get rid of (due date) at the end
 * Remove issue key

I found similar request in confluence questions, unfortunately no answer for the question. 

[https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Confluence-questions/Can-I-change-the-way-JIRA-issues-display-in-Team-Calendars/qaq-p/332748]

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When using a “Hybrid” cache in *Confluence 6.8* (data center, 2 nodes), that the statistics in the Confluence admin “Cache Management” page do not update. Entries/hit/miss/evicted remain at 0. However, they do appear for “Cluster” and “Local” type caches. These cache types are the ones referred to in the Atlassian Cache 2 overview documentation. 

https://developer.atlassian.com/server/confluence/atlassian-cache-2-overview/

Joe Xie has suggested that after speaking with the lead for hazelcast, it seems that this is probably a bug in the version of hazelcast that shipped in Confluence 6.8.

*Customer impact:*
While the cache still appears to work, it means sys admins are less likely to have confidence in our product and its quality. It gives the impression it isn't working properly.

*Steps to reproduce:*
# Create a P2 plugin that uses a hybrid cache (see example config below)
# Perform an action that uses the cache
# Open "Cache Management" in Confluence administration, and observe that the stats remain at 0

{code}
// Example config
CacheSettingsBuilder()
    .remote()
    .replicateViaInvalidation()
    .replicateAsynchronously()
    .maxEntries(10000)
    .expireAfterWrite(24, TimeUnit.HOURS)
    .build()
{code}

*Expected Result*
Cache statistics reflect the usage of the cache

*Actual Result*
They remain at 0

https://community.developer.atlassian.com/t/missing-confluence-hybrid-cache-statistics/19455
fields.summary: Confluence cache stats are missing for "Hybrid" caches (replicationByInvalidation)

fields.description:
When moving a page from one space to another, attachments linked to that page have to change location on disk to follow [storage hierarchy|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/hierarchical-file-system-attachment-storage-704578486.html].

This process is not reliable according to following references:
 - [https://confluence.atlassian.com/confkb/pages-can-not-be-copied-or-images-not-loaded-on-a-page-738722951.html/]
 - [https://confluence.atlassian.com/confkb/how-to-resolve-missing-attachments-in-confluence-201761.html]

[Tool proposed to fix situation|https://bitbucket.org/atlassianlabs/confluence-support-fix-missing-attachments] requires service downtime.

My suggestion consists in improving attachment move on disk storage in a reliable way.

The following sequence may be implemented to avoid timeout and keep Confluence internal state (DB and attachment storage) consistent in case of failure at any steps:
 # Create copies of page's attachment files on disk storage to new space expected target locations, if possible with a progress bar reported to user (in case of large, many attachments). Recommendation for performances: take benefits of file system hard links instead of full content copy, if available on current operating system.
 # Apply page move with attachments in database (single transaction)
 # If success, delete or unlink old attachment files at previous space locations

In case of failures, some attachment files (copies) in disk storage may be "orphan" with in new space storage (if failure in step 1) or in old space storage (if failure in step 3).

In Confluence, a health check can be implemented to detect such "orphaned" attachments. A tool to clean up situation does not require to service down-time - it only consists in deleting/unlinking files with reference in database.
fields.summary: Make attachments move operation reliable

fields.description:
Confluence installations have permissive whitelist that allows to fetch any URL using confluence like as the proxy.

Use GET request {{GET /plugins/servlet/gadgets/makeRequest?url=}}

Example:
 to get Yandex start page or any resource you want.
{code:java}
GET /plugins/servlet/gadgets/makeRequest?url=http://ya.ru HTTP/1.1
Host: xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx
User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64; rv:52.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/52.0
Accept: text/html,application/xhtml+xml,application/xml;q=0.9,*/*;q=0.8
Accept-Language: en-US,en;q=0.5
Accept-Encoding: gzip, deflate
Cookie: s_cc=true; s_nr=1521467033623-New; s_vnum=1522558800623%26vn%3D1; s_sq=%5B%5BB%5D%5D
DNT: 1
X-Atlassian-Token: no-check
Connection: close
Upgrade-Insecure-Requests: 1
{code}
 

*Update*

This issue was fixed in Confluence version 4.2.14. If you are experiencing this issue in a newer version of Confluence then please check the configuration of the in product whitelist as per [https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/configuring-the-whitelist-381255821.html].
fields.summary: SSRF via REST API /plugins/servlet/gadgets/makeRequest

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian Update – 24/02/2020|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ebf2f9 | titleBGColor=#ebf2f9 | bgColor=#ffffff}
Hi Everyone,
 
We have recently reviewed this issue and as the News gadget has reached End of Support and has been removed from later versions of Confluence, we will be closing this issue.
* [Deprecated Gadgets in Confluence (12 March 2019)|https://confluence.atlassian.com/conf615/end-of-support-announcements-for-confluence-967338804.html#EndofSupportAnnouncementsforConfluence-DeprecatedGadgetsinConfluence(12March2019)]

If you have any questions or updates regarding this macro, do let us know.

Thank you
{panel}

h4. Issue Summary
Confluence News Gadget doesn't work because of [Cross-Origin Read Blocking (CORB)|https://www.chromestatus.com/feature/5629709824032768]. 

h4. Steps to Replicate
# Create a page
# Insert Confluence New Gadget
# Click "Insert"
# The 'Edit' button will get greyed out and unclickable

The following error can be found in the browser console:
{code}
Cross-Origin Read Blocking (CORB) blocked cross-origin response https://www.atlassian.com/software with MIME type text/html
{code}

The following request will return error 500:
{code}
https://<confluence-base-url>/s/2325/_/plugins/servlet/gadgets/placeholder?gadgetId=cmVzdC9nYWRnZXRzLzEuMC9nL2NvbS5hdGxhc3NpYW4uY29uZmx1ZW5jZS5wbHVnaW5zLmdhZGdldHM6Y29uZmx1ZW5jZS1uZXdzLWdhZGdldC9nYWRnZXRzL2NvbmZsdWVuY2UtbmV3cy1nYWRnZXQueG1s
{code}

The following error can be found in the application logs:
{code}
ERROR [http-nio-8443-exec-110] [[Standalone].[localhost].[/].[servlet-module-container-servlet]] log Servlet.service() for servlet servlet-module-container-servlet threw exception
-- referer: https://<confluence-base-url>/display/<space>/<page-name> | url: /s/2325/_/plugins/servlet/gadgets/placeholder | traceId: 75cbaae96215db5f | userName: username
java.lang.NullPointerException
at com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.gadgets.GadgetPlaceholderServlet.getIcon(GadgetPlaceholderServlet.java:305)
at com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.gadgets.GadgetPlaceholderServlet.getPlaceholderImage(GadgetPlaceholderServlet.java:264)
at com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.gadgets.GadgetPlaceholderServlet.lambda$doGet$1(GadgetPlaceholderServlet.java:171)
at com.atlassian.vcache.internal.core.metrics.TimedSupplier.get(TimedSupplier.java:32)
at com.atlassian.vcache.internal.legacy.LegacyJvmCache.lambda$get$4(LegacyJvmCache.java:52)
at java.util.Optional.orElseGet(Optional.java:267)
at com.atlassian.vcache.internal.legacy.LegacyJvmCache.get(LegacyJvmCache.java:50)
{code}	

h4. Expected Result
Confluence News Gadget to display a list of recent Confluence Product Blogs and events at Atlassian.

h4. Actual Result
The macro doesn't return anything and break the editor.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Load time for pages with page properties macro report will be significantly degraded after upgrade to Confluence 6.8.1.
If pages have external gadgets load time will be even slower.

h3. Environment
* Confluence 6.8.1

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create 200 pages with page properties macro
# Create single page with page properties report macro.
# Load page

h3. Expected Results
Page initial request will load in less then 1s (local test 0.2s). And page in less then ~10sec.

h3. Actual Results
100 pages:
 !100pages.jpeg|thumbnail! 
200 pages:
 !200pages.jpeg|thumbnail! 
 
h3. Notes
Issue was not present in Confluence 6.5.1
 !6.5.1-200pages.jpeg|thumbnail! 

Bug affects these libraries:
confluence-masterdetail-plugin-parent-5.1.0
confluence-masterdetail-plugin-parent-5.1.1


h3.Workaround
In some cases, disabling external gadgets can help in load time.

One way to workaround is obtain  com/atlassian/confluence/macro/macro-asyncsafe-whitelist.properties file (extracting it from confluence.jar) and then adding bottom line to the file. Then copy the file into <installation-directory>/confluence/WEB-INF/classes/com/atlassian/confluence/macro/macro-asyncsafe-whitelist.properties

{noformat}
detailssummary=true
{noformat}

Then restart of Confluence (see [https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/installing-patched-class-files-166528493.html)]

For reference file [^macro-asyncsafe-whitelist.properties] is attached to the ticket.
fields.summary: Slow load speed for page using Page Properties Macro report - regression

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

When admins upgrade to a data center license after their previous standalone license expires, applying the license to Confluence forces a migration to Data Center, whether the admin is ready to perform this transition or not.
h3. Suggested Solution

Allow the option to apply a Data Center license without migrating the instance to Data Center. This would allow admins to use a valid data center license on a standalone instance while taking time to plan for a transition to data center if needed.
h3. Workaround

If the previous license is expired, and the admin is not ready to transition to Data Center, the admin can generate a 30-day evaluation license at [https://my.atlassian.com|https://my.atlassian.com/] to buy time before the transition.
fields.summary: Don't force transition to Data Center with Data Center license

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When a Service Desk user access a TinyLink of a "Service Desk Knowledge Base", the user gets a "Not Permitted" page, however, if this same user access the full URL of the space, he is able to access that specific space.

According to [CONFSERVER-45631|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-45631], "Unlicensed users can only access the spaces if they have the direct links", however, the link of the space is working, only its TinyURL that isn't.

We can see that it appears that there's a layer when Confluence is redirecting the URL that is not accessible for Service Desk Users, but this layer should not be active when the space is linked to Service Desk.

h3. Environment

* Confluence 
* Service Desk

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Connect Confluence with Service Desk.
# Create a test space.
# Link this new space to a Service Desk Project(Service Desk Knowledge Base).
# Create a Service Desk User.
# Access the full URL of the space just to confirm that the unlicensed user can view it.
# Go back to the space, get its TinyURL and share with the Service Desk user.

h3. Expected Results
The user will be able to view the space through its TinyURL.

h3. Actual Results
The user gets a "Not Permitted" page.
 
h3. Notes
* Same problem doesn't happen with Anonymous Users, only with Service Desk users. Ensure that Anonymous access is disabled in order to confirm the problem.
* This can be a blocker if customers are sharing TinyLinks to their customers.

h3.Workaround
If you are able to share the full link, use it instead of the space's TinyURL. If you are not able to do that, then there is no other workaround.
fields.summary: Space's TinyURL not working for Service Desk users(unlicensed)

fields.description:
Each time message is opened from Mail Archive, it builds thread by searching related messages and organising them into tree. This searching/tree building process takes quadratic time and memory relative to how many related messages have been found. Currently we treat related messages as either
* Having reference between each other using 'References' email field
* Having similar subject to each other

The problem here is that there's no upper limit on number of related messages. If their number is about 20K, it takes several minutes for thread building process to finish. As this operation is Lucene and CPU heavy, it can bring Confluence down.

We should at least provide some way to limit the number of messages in thread in order to save application from OOMs and CPU spikes.

*System variable*
{code:java}
-Dconfluence.mail.archive.thread.limit=250
{code}
fields.summary: Limit the number of messages that are used for thread building in Mail Archiving Plugin

fields.description:
h4. Problem Description
Administrators may need to verify if links inside their Confluence pages are working properly. Doing that for a huge space requires time, since there's no automated way of doing this. In a space with 1000 pages, an administrator will need to check page by page and validate all links manually, which is extremely time consuming.

h4. Suggestion
Confluence should have an automated way of verifying all links inside a given space and return a report for administrators to fix broken references.

h4. Workaround
There's a [Knowledge Base|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confkb/confluence-how-to-validate-links-952603062.html] that seeks to help administrators who need to run through this task.
fields.summary: Confluence - Link Report/Link Validator

fields.description:
h3. Summary
If when you are creating a new page, for some reason, the user ends up clicking to *create* a new page, the published result will not be shown on the page tree. The page must be moved so it can be shown. The page is not listed under Orphaned pages or the reorder pages menu. The page appears under the *Pages* section for said space.

(i) This *does not* happen with collaborative editing turned off (i)

h3. Steps to reproduce
# Go to a Space
# Click to *Create a new Page*
# Enter some *dummy title and text*
# Do not save the page
# Click to *create page* again
# Enter some *dummy title and text*
# Publish the page

h3. Expected Results
- The page is created and is shown under the Page Tree root

h3. Actual Results
- The page is created but is not shown under both page tree or reorder pages menu


h3. Workaround
# Deactivate Collaborative editing Or
# Publish the parent draft page
fields.summary: Create New Page From Edit Mode Does Not Include Page In Page Hierarchy

h3. Summary

Team Calendar no longer work after updating to version 6.0.15. When user click the calendar tab, they will see the error ORA-01741.
h3. Step to replicate

 # Install a Team calendar 6.0.14 or below

 # Click Calendar tab

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-39313].
  {panel}

In Confluence our users doesn't have an option to remove the profile picture, or a function to return to the default one(_when you don't have a profile picture_).

Our customer asked some instructions of how to remove the profile picture since it doesn't have anything in the User Interface. The only way that we found was through the database by removing an row from the *os_propertyentry* table and a script created by another customer in the [Atlassian Answer|https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/19144203].

Confluence should have a "Delete" button as the *5.1.5* version has.

*Steps to reproduce*:
# Go to your Profile page.
# Upload an image.
# Try to delete without uploading a new one.

h3. Temporary workaround
Upload a new or default picture.
 !default.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Option to remove the profile picture or a Delete button

fields.description: We have a use case where administrators would like to know for auditing purposes "when a page or attachment has been deleted" as soon as it happens or on a regular basis. This would prompt administrators to be more mindful of removing content marked for deletion.
fields.summary: Add a method to track when a page or attachment has been deleted in realtime

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When you share or create a page with special characters(like forward and back slashes), the embedded URL's will not be transformed to its page ID or will not replace the characters.

For example, a page named "Morning Report 06/13/18" will have its URL as http://localhost:8090/confluence/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=2195460. However, this doesn't happen when the page is shared.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Setup an SMTP Mail server.
# Create a page named "Morning Report 06/13/18".
# Insert an image to the body of the page.
# Ensure that you user subscribed the space and is a watcher.
# See your mail box.
# Inspect the broken image icon.

h3. Expected Results

The embedded URL will be transformed and you will be able to see the image while accessing its URL.

h3. Actual Results
The URL will point to a non-existing URL and it will show a "Page not Found":

- http://localhost:8090/confluence/download/attachments/embedded-blogpost/TES/2018/06/18/Morning%20Report%2006/13/18/happy.png?api=v2

As you can see, the page's title(url) is now "Morning%20Report%2006/13/18". It is transforming blank spaces but not special characters.
 
h3. Notes
If you don't use special characters, the embedded url will show the attachment, for example http://localhost:8090/confluence/download/attachments/embedded-blogpost/TES/2018/06/18/Morning%20Report%20/happy.png?api=v2

h3.Workaround
No workaround.
fields.summary: Wrong URL in email notifications(attachments)

fields.description:
h2. Summary
When creating a new page in Confluence, Synchrony will throw a 404 response in the background since it doesn't know about the newly created content yet. Although this is an expected behaviour, it doesn't work well with [Custom Error Response|https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonCloudFront/latest/DeveloperGuide/custom-error-pages.html] software, like Amazon CloudFront, for instance, since it can't be set to avoid checking specific URLs.

The same behavior occurs when pages were created while Collaborative Editing (CE) was OFF and they are updated for the first time after CE is turned ON.

h2. Suggestion
Gracefully handle this situation and have Synchrony returning a different status (ideally, 200) instead of 404. Synchrony may be configured to know that it doesn't know the content yet because it is new and just acknowledge it instead of throwing an error.

h2. Impact
For administrators who wish to display friendly error pages instead of a 404 page to users through [Custom Error Response|https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonCloudFront/latest/DeveloperGuide/custom-error-pages.html] software like CloudFront, this is a showstopper. The editor will be locked spinning and won't allow users to edit pages, since CloudFront will grab the 404 and understand it as an error.

h2. Steps to Replicate
# Setup a Custom Error Response in CloudFront or any other software/provider you may be using. Screenshot below:
!Screen Shot 2018-06-25 at 12.54.49.png|thumbnail!
# Access Confluence.
# Create a new page. Editor will be busted unless you disable the Custom Error Response.
# This happens because in the background, 404 is throw as can be seen in the screenshot below:
!Screen Shot 2018-06-18 at 12.40.54.png|thumbnail!
# URL that throws the problem is:
{code}
Request URL: http://localhost:8075/synchrony-proxy/v1/data/Synchrony-e15e9edb-ebce-35ba-968a-0635574a54b6/confluence-1277954?state-at=@head&state-format=type-tagged&rewrite-request=true&cached=true
{code}

*Scenario 2*:
 # Turn Collaborative Editing (CE) OFF.
 # Create and publish a sample page.
 # Turn CE ON.
 # Edit the same page.

h2. Workaround
Disable Custom Error Response for 404 responses or disable Synchrony (worst case scenario).

h2. Related Information
This has been previously raised as a bug ([CONFSERVER-43777|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-43777]) and closed due to expect behaviour. It is now being raised as a Suggestion instead due to the impact listed above. :)
fields.summary: Synchrony - 404 When Creating New Pages

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
If you insert multiple images next to each other in a page, Confluence will add some padding in between the images.

h3. Suggested Solution
Add the ability to remove the padding between the images in a Confluence page
 
h3. Workaround
The available workaround is to customize the CSS for those images on that page using a third party plugin

h3. Step to reproduce the issue:
# Integrate Confluence with a JIRA instance and create the application link. 
# Create a new page and type quickly the following string:
{code}
{JIRA: FP-2}
{code}
which FP-2 is one example issue key on JIRA.
# Save the page

h3. Expected behavior 
The JIRA issue link from the JIRA issue macro should be "<JIRA base URL>/browse/FP-2"

h3. Actual behavior
The JIRA issue link from the JIRA issue macro is "<JIRA base URL>/browse/+FP-2" which point to a dead link.

h3. Workaround solution 
Open the JIRA issue macro UI then save it should help in this case.

fields.description:
The *calendar-section-provider* module of Team Calendar 6+ is broken and Calendar search does not show up in the quick navigation option.

Upgrade or install any Team Calendar version 6+ to 6.0.14(at time of testing), and look at the modules section of the add-on.
1) All the add-ons will appear fine and enabled. (Except *event* which is disabled by default)
2) Now search for any Calendar in the quick nav, but do not hit enter.
3) The matching calendars should show up, but they do not.
4) Go back to the list of modules for Team Calendar, and there will be a *This module is broken* message next to *calendar-section-provider*.
5) Disabling and enabling the module will remove the message, but Step 2 will bring the error message back.
6) Hitting enter in the search will return the results, just before.

*Expected results:*
 !cal_search_5.PNG|thumbnail! 

*Actual results:*
Calendars do not show up in the search box, only in the results after hitting enter.

*Workaround:*
Uninstall and manually install *team-calendars-5.3.20* instead.

fields.summary: Team Calendar calendar-section-provider module broken

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Moving Pages with duplicate parent and child names between spaces produces an unknown error:
 !Screen Shot 2018-06-18 at 12.43.27.png|thumbnail!
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a page and give it a unique name, i.e "test_page"
 # Create a child page under it with a unique name, i.e "child_page"
 # Go to different space and repeat steps 1 & 2 with exact same names respectfully
 # Attempt to move parent "test_page" page from one space to another

h3. Expected Results

Error logged for parent and each child page in WebUI:
{quote}The following error(s) occurred:
 The page 'test_page' already exists in space 'SPACE'. You need to rename the page title before moving it.
 The page 'child_page' already exists in space 'SPACE'. You need to rename the page title before moving it.
{quote}
h3. Actual Results

The Following error appears in WebUI instead:
{quote}The following error(s) occurred:
 * $error
 * $error{quote}

h3. Notes
The issue is not observed on Confluence 6.8.1
The issue is not observed when only 1 page is duplicate

h3. Workaround
Attempting to copy pages instead of moving them will list correct duplicate page titles
OR

fields.description:
h3. *Summary*

While creating Support Zip in Confluence, the process of generating Support Zip is successful, though the user is unable to download it from the browser.

h3. *Testing Environment*

Windows Server 2012 R2
Confluence v6.6.0
UPM v2.22.11
ATST v 1.8.1

h3. *Steps to Reproduce*

# Install a new Confluence v6.6.0 on Windows Server
# In Confluence navigate to *Troubleshooting and support tools* in General Configuration.
# Create Support Zip.
# Wait till the Support zip is successfully completed.
# Select *Download zip*. 


h3. *Expected Result*

User should be able to download the Support Zip via browser.

h3. *Actual Result*

User gets an HTTP ERROR 400 and the Support Zip is not downloaded.


 !HTTP 400.png|thumbnail! 

h3. *Diagnosis*

Browser is receiving incorrect file path from the server.
{code}
http://<Confluence-Base-URL>/plugins/servlet/troubleshooting/support-zip/download?file=C:\conf-home\export\Confluence_support_2018-06-18-16-50-47.zip
{code}

The correct path is like following:
{code}
http://<Confluence-Base-URL>/plugins/servlet/troubleshooting/support-zip/download?file=Confluence_support_2018-06-18-16-50-47.zip
{code}


h3. *Resolution*

Upgrade ATST to v1.11.0

# Navigate to *General Configuration* > *Manage Add-ons*
# Select *Upload add-on*
# Place the following URL in *From this URL*
#* {code}https://marketplace.atlassian.com/download/apps/1217697/version/11100{code}
# Select *Upload*
fields.summary: Unable to download Support Zip in Windows

fields.description:
h2. Problem summary
While adding a new row to a table when there are merged cells present, the new row's merge behavior is inconsistent.

||Cell merge type on current row||New row position||Result||
|Cells merged across columns|Insert above|Cells in new row copies the current row's merges (/)|
|Cells merged across columns|Insert below|Cells in new row copies the current row's merges (/)|
|Cells merged across rows|Insert above|Cells in new row does not extend the current row's merged cells (x)|
|Cells merged across rows|Insert below|Cells in new row extends the current row's merged cells (/)|

The third scenario stands out from the rest as it does not not *extend* the merged cells, and instead inserts a standalone cell above the merged cells. It appears to duplicate the row formatting from the row *above* instead of using the current row's formatting.

The fourth scenario inserts a row below, and it does correctly extend the merged cells so that now the merge is one cell longer.
fields.summary: Inconsistent behavior with adding a new row while there are merged cells

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian Update - 19 May 2021|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#6554c0|titleBGColor=#6554c0|bgColor=#eae6ff|titleColor=#ffffff} (!) *PLEASE NOTE:* This fix will stop new occurrences of the bug. It does not correct pages already affected by the bug. We have released a plugin to begin correcting pages that already affected, you can obtain more details about it on the related issue [CONFSERVER\-63615: Provide workaround for fixing broken unknown attachment placeholder in storage format|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-63615] ---- Previously we released what we believed was a fix in Confluence 7.4.6 and 7.8.0, and closed this ticket. Unfortunately this fix was only partial, so customers running these and subsequent versions have a partial fix in place. It turns out this issue was more complex than we had previously understood and we apologise to anyone inconvenienced by the bug or the partial fix. Whilst this ticket addresses the bug itself and should stop future occurrences, we understand a significant number of our customers are already impacted with some impacted across a large number of pages and drafts. With this in mind, we've created [CONFSERVER\-63615: Provide workaround for fixing broken unknown attachment placeholder in storage format|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-63615] to track our work on creating a method to fix the issue for customers already impacted. This ticket is currently in progress. To be clear, whilst the goal is to have some method that automatically corrects the issue for impacted customers, there may be some cases wherein automatic correction is not possible and manual intervention may be required. Hopefully we can find a one click solution, but I want to set expectations early and clearly that it may not be possible. We appreciate your continued patience as we continue working to finalise this issue. Thanks, James Ponting Premier Support Engineer {panel} h4. Summary When the storage format of a page embeds an image that is _not yet_ attached to the page, the image will still be rendered as "Unknown attachment" in the page editor although the image has been added to the page beforehand. h4. Steps to replicate # Ensure Collaborative Editing is switched on. # Create a page with this storage format. {code:xml}

{code} # The page displays "Unknown attachment". # Via '{{...}}' > '*Attachments*', just insert an attachment 'test.jpg' into the page. You'll see that the page now contains 1 attachment, which is 'test.jpg'. # View the page you first created and the image is now there. # Edit the page. h4. Expected results The image would still be displayed. h4. Actual results The image is now replaced by the initial "Unknown attachment" message. !CONFSERVER-55928 - Unknown attachment.png|thumbnail! h4. Notes If a script that uses REST API to automate the process of creating/copying pages and uploading attachments to it is being used, please remember to follow the order below in the creation of the page to avoid being affected by this bug: # create a page in Confluence # add the attachments to this created page # update the page with the expected content, in the storage format, using REST API h4. Workaround h5. Option 1 (preferred) - If the storage format is not yet broken with unknown placeholder. Leave an inline comment on any text of the page. You can delete or resolve it immediately afterwards. Attachment upload doesn't change page storage format, so the code path that triggers sending view page updates to synchrony is not used. Leaving an inline comment triggers the path, pushing updated editor format data into synchrony.   h5. Option 2 - For Confluence 6.9 and up # Open the editor for the affected page # Click on the ellipsis button on the bottom right corner of the screen (besides the Close button) # Click on *revert back to the last published version* # Check if the attachment appears on the editor now The problem is caused by the draft entry on the DB being created before the attachment exists. The application replaces the attachment name with *plugins/servlet/confluence/placeholder/unknown-attachment?locale=en_US&version=2* in that situation. Following the steps from Option 2 creates a new draft entry for this page, so it is able to recognize the attachment. h4. Additional Issues {panel:title=Update of Unknown Attachments on versions greater than 7.7.3} Confluence can generate an attachment XML with {{}} that renders as an unknown attachment. When it happens, it affects the whole page and will likely impact multiple pages. An examlpe of the issue is shown below {code:xml}

{code} You can check which issue you may be facing by reviewing the Storage Format of the impacted page for something similar to the XML above with the {{content-entity}} tag. We're currently tracking this issue at CONFSERVER-60526: Confluence generates attachment xml with that renders as an unknown attachment. {panel}
fields.summary: Attachments become 'Unknown Attachment' in the page editor with Collaborative Editing turned on

fields.description:
h4. Summary
Jira Issue Table with 'Epic Link' column will take much longer to render compared to a table that doesn't have 'Epic Link' column in it.

h4. Environment
Tested on Confluence 6.8 + Jira Software 7.8

h4. Steps to Replicate
# Create a test project in Jira (eg. *TEST*)
# Create ~1000 Jira Issue in Jira with Epic Link in *TEST*
# In Confluence, insert a Jira Issue Macro with {{project=TEST}} as the search filter
# Include "*Epic Link*" in the *Columns to display* option
# Set *Maximum issues* to 1000
# Insert
# Observe the amount of time taken to load the table
# Edit the Jira Issue Macro and remove "*Epic Link*" in the *Columns to display* option (leave the rest as it is)
# Insert
# Observe the amount of time taken to load the table again

h4. Expected Behavior
The table loads quickly with or without "Epic Link" column

h4. Actual Behavior
According to test results, it took ~2 seconds for the table to populate *without Epic Link*. On the other hand, it took ~15 seconds for the table to populate *with Epic Link*. 

||Condition||Load Time||HAR File||
|With "Epic Link"| ~15 seconds|[^with epic link.har]|
|Without "Epic Link"| ~2 seconds|[^without epic link.har]|

h4. Note
* Jira Issue Macro starts showing notable slowness while *Maximum issues* is set to 500 or above. 
* If Confluence took longer than the expected timeframe, you'll notice the following message:
 !timeout.png|thumbnail! 
* The same issue is also observed when 'Epic Name' column is added to the filter as well.

h4. Workaround
* Increase socket timeout as suggested in [Timeouts in the JIRA Issues Macro or Highlighting Plugin|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confkb/timeouts-in-the-jira-issues-macro-or-highlighting-plugin-726108967.html]
* Lower the amount of issue display in the table.
fields.summary: 'Epic Link' column causes longer load time for Jira Issue Macro
